member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Kanban.SfKanban
member.summary: The Kanban control offers an efficient way to visualize workflows at each stage of completion, aiding in planning and providing a clear view of task progression. It offers various features to effectively monitor task progress throughout the software development lifecycle, allowing users to control task transitions between categories (statuses). The control supports easy task binding through the ItemsSource property and enables grouping tasks using horizontal swimlanes to organize and display related tasks by categories, teams, or other groupings. You can customize the control's appearance using ColumnHeaderTemplate, CardTemplate, CardTemplateSelector, SwimlaneHeaderTemplate, and customizable placeholders. It includes a rich set of built-in functionalities such as data binding, swimlanes, card templating, scrolling, drag-and-drop, WIP validations, responsiveness, various built-in themes, and more.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Kanban.SfKanban.SortingOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the sorting order that determines the direction in which cards are sorted within a column.

remarks.para: This property is applicable only when a valid value is assigned to .
Sorting behavior: In order, cards with lower values appear first. In order, cards with higher values appear first.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Kanban.SfKanban.SortingMappingPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the property name used for sorting cards within a Kanban column.
member.remarks:
This should match a valid property name in the bound data model (e.g., or a custom model). If the specified property does not exist or is unreadable, sorting will be skipped.
When set to string.Empty (default), no sorting is applied, and cards are displayed in the order they appear in the view model collection.
